intro: Acmispon glaber, commonly known as slender blueweed, is a low-growing annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has trifoliate leaves with three oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Acmispon glaber is a hardy plant that is well adapted to arid environments and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
